channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 在一次采访中，弗拉基米尔-普京总统试图淡化人们对核战争的恐惧，目的是在本周末的俄罗斯总统大选前巩固其作为稳定保障者的国内形象。
item.description:
In an interview, President Vladimir Putin tried to play down fears of nuclear war, aiming to bolster his domestic image as a guarantor of stability before this weekend’s Russian presidential election. https://t.co/QS2UMXHb3j

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰对俄罗斯发动了跨境地面袭击和远程无人机袭击，这些袭击似乎旨在破坏弗拉基米尔-普京总统的连任竞选活动。
item.description:
Ukraine staged cross-border ground attacks and long-range drone strikes into Russia, assaults that appeared aimed at disrupting President Vladimir V. Putin’s re-election campaign messaging that the war has turned in Moscow’s favor. https://t.co/j8cKJGgeMy

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 她从女权主义和反殖民主义的视角审视了故土的权力动态和艰难历史。
item.description:
She examined the power dynamics and difficult history of her native land from a feminist, anticolonial perspective. https://t.co/n8WV5NBuKD

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: "@rasmus_kleis 告诉 @marklandler 关于社交媒体对凯瑟琳王妃的痴迷，"这些空间非常模糊，人们想要的东西与令人深感不安的东西密不可分。
item.description:
“These are deeply ambiguous spaces, in which things that people want are inextricably linked with things that are deeply troubling,” @rasmus_kleis tells @marklandler about the social media obsession with Princess Catherine. https://t.co/XgKOrmNo45

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 经过多年的磨练，电子对抗已成为俄罗斯军队最强大的武器之一。
item.description:
Electronic countermeasures have become one of the Russian military’s most formidable weapons after years of honing their capabilities. https://t.co/GAghSpYD63

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 马尼亚-拉兹雷格（Marnia Lazreg）是亨特学院的一名阿尔及利亚裔社会学家，她曾质疑妇女戴面纱的合理性，现已去世，享年 83 岁。
item.description:
Marnia Lazreg, a Hunter College sociologist of Algerian origin who challenged justifications for women to wear veils, has died at 83. https://t.co/bkYyLQhRPk

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 14, 2024

item.title: 德国立法者正在重写章程并推动宪法修正案，以确保法院和州议会免受极端政客的影响。但这些变化可能会适得其反。
item.description:
German lawmakers are rewriting bylaws and pushing for constitutional amendments to ensure courts and state parliaments are protected from extremist politicians. But those changes could backfire. https://t.co/f8UqyjHbup

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 13, 2024

item.title: 美国和其他国家向巴勒斯坦领导人马哈茂德-阿巴斯施压，要求他任命一位具有一定独立性的总理。他有其他想法。
item.description:
The United States and other countries have pressed Mahmoud Abbas, the Palestinian leader, to name a prime minister with some independence. He has other ideas. https://t.co/DkL8wnn9iv

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 13, 2024

item.title: 以色列允许一个援助车队直接进入加沙北部，这是自 10 月 7 日以来的第一次，但救援组织表示还需要更多的援助。
item.description:
Israel has allowed an aid convoy directly into northern Gaza, the first since Oct. 7, but relief groups say much more is needed. https://t.co/TbY4RBNIvj

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 13, 2024

item.title: 一位谴责入侵乌克兰的科技大亨成为少数成功解除西方对其制裁的俄罗斯富豪之一。
item.description:
A tech tycoon who denounced the invasion of Ukraine became one of the few wealthy Russians to succeed in having Western sanctions against him lifted. https://t.co/onyRgETz9M

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 13, 2024

item.title: "战争期间，一个电话就能决定生死"工人们冒着生命危险修复加沙的电话网络。
item.description:
“During a war, the difference between life and death can be one phone call.” Workers are risking their lives to fix Gaza’s phone network. https://t.co/NqdszG7NYO

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 13, 2024

item.title: 据一名乌克兰官员和一名西方官员称，在乌克兰对俄罗斯黑海舰队发动一系列打击后，克里姆林宫解雇了其最高海军指挥官。
item.description:
After a series of Ukrainian strikes on Russia’s Black Sea Fleet, the Kremlin fired its top naval commander, according to a Ukrainian and a Western official. https://t.co/lOdVj72NXJ

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 13, 2024

item.title: 在以色列占领的约旦河西岸，巴勒斯坦人在迎接斋月时并没有像往常一样欢呼雀跃。一位妇女说，知道加沙有许多人在挨饿，她很难坐下来吃饭："我一直在问自己，他们吃饭了吗？
item.description:
Palestinians in the Israeli-occupied West Bank are welcoming Ramadan with little of the usual cheer.

One woman said she had a hard time sitting down for meals knowing that many in Gaza were starving: “I keep asking myself, did they eat?” https://t.co/eYozi68CAt

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 13, 2024

item.title: 法国最精英的大学之一发现自己在短短三年内第二次失去了领导者，因为该校校长因被指控家庭暴力而面临法庭诉讼而辞职。
item.description:
One of France’s most elite universities found itself without a leader for the second time in just three years after its director resigned as he faces a court case over accusations of domestic violence. https://t.co/uU0RIhfmIp

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 13, 2024

item.title: 阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼的一名高级助手在立陶宛的住所外遭到锤子殴打和催泪瓦斯喷射。
item.description:
A top aide to Aleksei Navalny was beaten with a hammer and sprayed with tear gas outside his house in Lithuania. https://t.co/kjjakiuO8Q

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 13, 2024

item.title: 新闻分析：威廉王子和凯瑟琳王妃，还有哈里王子，最初拥抱社交媒体是为了避开他们所憎恶的小报。但现在，年轻的王室成员们正在互联网上体验公众生活的阴暗面。
item.description:
News Analysis: Prince William and Princess Catherine, along with Prince Harry, initially embraced social media as a way to bypass the tabloids they reviled. But now the younger royals are experiencing the darker side of public life on the internet. https://t.co/oYWTSwCTH7

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 13, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯的贸易一度依赖欧洲，但它一直在开辟新的路线，以避开西方的限制。计划中的一条穿越伊朗的铁路可能是实现这些野心的关键。
item.description:
Once dependent on Europe for trade, Russia has been forging new routes that will allow it to skirt Western restrictions. A planned railway through Iran could be key for those ambitions. https://t.co/7hsLxZ9una

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 13, 2024

item.title: 中国周三谴责美国立法者强迫 TikTok 的中国母公司出售这一流行的短视频平台。
item.description:
China on Wednesday condemned U.S. lawmakers’ push to force the Chinese parent company of TikTok to sell the popular short video platform. https://t.co/JxsnluyZhk

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 13, 2024

item.title: 在援助机构警告加沙即将发生饥荒之际，三个家庭分享了他们每天为寻找食物而挣扎的照片和视频。
item.description:
As aid agencies warned that Gaza was nearing famine, three families shared photos and videos of their daily struggle to find food. https://t.co/ii8Cz52qux

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 13, 2024

item.title: 以色列允许联合国运送食品的卡车车队直接进入加沙北部。此举正值以色列面临越来越大的全球压力，要求其允许更多援助进入加沙之际。
item.description:
Israel allowed a convoy of U.N. trucks carrying food to directly enter northern Gaza. The move came as Israel faces intensifying global pressure to let more aid into the territory.

Follow updates. https://t.co/UfO9tRCn0q

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 13, 2024

item.title: 由于乌克兰战争援助在国会陷入僵局，白宫宣布了一项提供最多 3 亿美元武器的权宜之计。
item.description:
With Ukraine war aid stalled in Congress, the White House announced a stopgap plan to provide up to $300 million in weapons. https://t.co/tHGauOEige

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 13, 2024

item.title: 本周三，日本初创公司 Space One 发射的首枚火箭在起飞数秒后爆炸，使其成为该国首家将卫星送入轨道的私营公司的雄心受到挫折。
item.description:
The first rocket launched by the Japanese start-up Space One exploded seconds after takeoff on Wednesday, denting its ambition to become the country’s first private company to put a satellite into orbit. https://t.co/qHr3OC5IU7

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 13, 2024

item.title: 即时新闻：肯尼亚以海地总理有意下台为由，暂停向海地派遣警察部队打击帮派暴力的计划。
item.description:
Breaking News: Kenya paused its plans to send a police force to Haiti to combat gang violence, citing the Haitian prime minister’s intent to step down. https://t.co/6RGcnTpjho

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 12, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰周二对俄罗斯发动了一系列越境地面袭击和远程无人机袭击，这些袭击似乎旨在扰乱弗拉基米尔-普京总统的连任竞选宣传，即战争已转向对莫斯科有利的方向。
item.description:
Ukraine staged a flurry of cross-border ground attacks and long-range drone strikes into Russia on Tuesday, assaults that appeared aimed at disrupting President Vladimir V. Putin’s re-election campaign messaging that the war had turned in Moscow’s favor. https://t.co/dInMJLQTQw

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 12, 2024

item.title: Geert Wilders 在荷兰的崛起为欧洲提供了一个试验案例，因为欧洲正在努力解决如何处理极右翼势力的问题，这些势力已经跻身主流，很难再被视为边缘势力。
item.description:
The ascent of Geert Wilders in the Netherlands offers a test case for Europe as it grapples with the question of what to do with far-right forces that have advanced so far into the mainstream that they can hardly be considered on the fringe anymore. https://t.co/k3YRQhcLaF

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 12, 2024

item.title: 美国高级情报官员警告说，如果没有美国的额外援助，乌克兰将面临战场持续失利的前景，因为俄罗斯依赖于重要的武器供应商网络，并大幅增加了来自中国的技术供应。
item.description:
Senior U.S. intelligence officials warned that without additional U.S. aid, Ukraine faced the prospect of continued battlefield losses as Russia relies on a network of critical arms suppliers and drastically increases its supply of technology from China. https://t.co/egjmiZVfAQ

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 12, 2024

item.title: 安德鲁-泰特（Andrew Tate）和他的兄弟特里斯坦（Tristan）因英国当局发出的欧洲逮捕令于周一在罗马尼亚被拘押，泰特的发言人说。
item.description:
Andrew Tate, the influencer known for his misogynistic views, and his brother, Tristan, were taken into custody on Monday in Romania on a European arrest warrant issued by the British authorities, a spokesman for Tate said. https://t.co/AZOrJjm2IF

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 12, 2024

item.title: 在全国大选之前，印度政府突然宣布将开始执行被批评为反穆斯林的国籍法。
item.description:
Ahead of a national election, the Indian government has abruptly announced that it will begin enforcing a citizenship law criticized as anti-Muslim. https://t.co/6bGMoCJVSc

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 12, 2024

item.title: 世界中央厨房（World Central Kitchen）慈善机构和塞浦路斯政府表示，第一批运往加沙的海运援助物资已装载食品离开塞浦路斯。目前仍不清楚援助物资将如何卸载和分发。
item.description:
The first sea shipment of aid for Gaza left Cyprus carrying food from World Central Kitchen, the charity and the Cypriot government said. It remained unclear how the aid would be unloaded and distributed.

Follow updates. https://t.co/F57NdGsQjs

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 12, 2024

item.title: 威尔士王妃凯瑟琳长期远离公众视线，引发了有关她下落的如潮谣言，最终导致公众仍在寻找答案。
item.description:
The extended absence of Catherine, the Princess of Wales, from the public eye has propelled a tidal wave of rumors over her whereabouts, ultimately leaving the public still searching for answers.

Here's a timeline of key moments to help you catch up. https://t.co/fLqxWr27xb

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 12, 2024
